channel.title: GitHub on Memo Tut
channel.description: Recent content in GitHub on Memo Tut

item.title: [Python] If you create a program that automatically starts/ends the verification environment for pull requests, the verification progressed
item.description: # Article summary I wanted to put the sales involved in the development with GitHub Flow, that is, the development with a simple pull operation, and created such an environment. At that time, I made and released a web application that supplements some missing functions, so I will write various stories about it. (It’s not about whether or not you can actually use this web app, but rather that you want to improve your development with a similar flow.

item.title: [Python] Show grass on Google Nest Hub
item.description: I bought the Pixel 4 and received the Google Nest Hub. It seems to be usable as a digital photo frame. Since I'm sorry, I will display the grass image on GitHub. Google Nest Hub settings Immediately after purchase, Nest Hub will display an art gallery prepared by Google. Change this to a setting that allows you to view your favorite image. Launch the Google Home app on your iOS or Android device If you bought Nest Hub, you should have installed it Go to Nest Hub> Photo Frame Change the display image setting to Google Photos Change “Personal Photo Organize” setting to “Real-time shared albums only” Without this setting, GitHub grass images, etc.

item.title: [Python] Complete everything with Jupyter ~Introduction to nbdev~
item.description: This article was posted on the 4th day of the Buchan Advent Calendar 2019. This is an article for Jupyterer. Please check the formula for more details, as some are not fully understood. What is nbdev Perhaps succinctly, it’s a Python programming environment that completes your work in one Jupyter Notebook by including the role of an IDE. Created by fast.aiandcurrentlyindevelopmentfastaiv2 also uses nbdev. At present, trial and error such as EDA and model construction are often done using Jupyter Notebook, and it exists as a role of “exploring”.

item.title: [Python] If you use GitPod, you can use IDE and jupyter on iPad, so it's the best!
item.description: # TL;DR **Using GitPod, you can use IDE and jupyter on iPad, so it’s the best! ** Features of #GitPod GitPod has the following features. VS code-like IDE available Available in chrome and firefox Can be used by linking to an account with GitHub Public repositories are free, private repositories are available for a fee (9$/month ~) #This goal and procedure on chrome on iPad Build a Python programming environment (IDE and jupyterlab).

item.title: [Python] A new app form that works with GitHub: How to make GitHub Apps
item.description: GitHub Apps is a new format for applications that work with GitHub. This format is the marketplace for applications, announced with GitHub Marketplace. In other words, the ecosystem for creating GitHub Apps, publishing on the marketplace, and making money with it has been put in place. In this article, I’ll show you how to create GitHub Apps that spread such dreams. Application format that works with GitHub First, organize the format of applications that work with GitHub, including GitHub Apps.
